description: 1780, ultimately from Tundra Nenets парка, via Aleut parka and Russian па́рка (párka). Perhaps from Proto-Uralic; see dialectal Finnish parka (“rag, swaddling clothes”), which may be a cognate from Proto-Uralic, or an early borrowing from another Uralic language.

entries.meaning: (clothing) A long jacket with a hood which protects the wearer against rain and wind.
